section-block.flip_chart-concept-question: What do we do during different seasons?

flip_chart-centered-content.flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph: In winter, we wake. The world is white. It snowed and snowed all through the night. We skate and sled, and then head inside, to drink hot cocoa side by side.
In spring, it rains, then blows away, to come again another day. We plant a garden as bluebirds sing. The flowers bloom to welcome spring.
In summer, when the days are hot, we settle in a shady spot. We lay our blanket near the trees, and picnic to the buzz of bees.
In fall, we watch the leaves turn red, bright spots of color overhead. As pumpkins ripen, the air turns cool. We’re glad for our teacher and friends at school.
